bullet_points: Review the course idea and objectives.
List the essential competencies and skills for business professionals using ChatGPT strategically.
Consider both technical and ethical aspects (e.g., data privacy, bias minimization).
Identify measurable outcomes for each core competency, clarifying what success looks like for participants.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Analyze the course idea to identify core competencies and skills participants should develop.

bullet_points: Identify the foundational knowledge or experience required for participants to succeed in the course.
Specify any technical, business, or AI-related prerequisites.
Differentiate between mandatory and optional prerequisites to clarify required baseline knowledge versus beneficial background.
Ensure progression from basic to advanced topics.
Align modules with the competencies and skills identified in Step 1.
Explicitly mention how each proposed module addresses one or more of the core competencies from Step 1.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Propose 4-8 main modules that build logically from foundational to advanced concepts.

bullet_points: Provide a concise description of what each module covers.
Write learning goals using action verbs (e.g., 'Participants will be able to...').
sub_tasks.sub_task: For each module, write a description, key takeaways, and specific learning goals.

bullet_points: Identify which modules include hands-on exercises.
Suggest appropriate time allocations for these exercises.
Break down exercise durations by activity type, providing detailed guidance for complex versus simpler tasks.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Estimate exercise duration for hands-on modules.

bullet_points: Compile all module descriptions, learning goals, key takeaways, and exercise durations into a clear, organized markdown outline.
Ensure the outline is comprehensive and logically structured.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Write the full Course Outline in structured markdown format.
